training_organizations.name: Montana DPHHS – Child & Family Services Training
training_organizations.description: The Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services provides training for Child and Family Services Division staff. New CPS workers in Montana receive instruction on safety assessment, Montana child protection laws, and engagement with the state’s many rural and tribal communities. Ongoing training modules include topics like working with substance-affected families and recognizing trauma in children.

training_organizations.name: CASA of Montana
training_organizations.description: A statewide association supporting Court Appointed Special Advocate programs in Montana. Through this association, volunteers are recruited and trained to serve as CASAs in dependency cases across the state’s Judicial Districts. CASA volunteers in Montana advocate for the best interests of children in foster care, particularly in court hearings, providing judges with independent recommendations and ensuring each child’s voice is heard.

perpetrator_relationships.relationship: Victim Was Child of Boyfriend or Girlfriend

policies.TribalFoster: Yes, Tribes within state provide foster care
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.Def_Subtype_Abuse: Abuse includes physical abuse, psychological abuse, and sexual abuse
policies.Def_Subtype_Neglect: Neglect includes psychological neglect; Physical neglect includes failure to provide basic necessities, including nutrition, protective shelter from the elements, and appropriate clothing related to weather conditions, failure to provide cleanliness, and general supervision
policies.Exempt_OtherSpecify: Sexual abuse does not include any necessary touching of an infant's or toddler's genital area while attending to the sanitary or health care needs of that infant or toddler by a parent or other person responsible for the child's welfare
policies.DefHarm_OtherSpecify: Any form of child sex trafficking or human trafficking
policies.NearFatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.TribalFoster_Specify: Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes (CSKT); Blackfeet Nation; Crow Tribe; Fort Belknap Indian Community; Northern Cheyenne Tribe; Chippewa Cree Tribe
policies.TribalScreen_Specify: Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes (CSKT); Blackfeet; Crow Agency; Fort Belknap; Fort Peck Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes; Northern Cheyenne; Chippewa Cree
policies.Reporter_OtherSpecify: Religious healers; Residential worker; An employee of an entity that contracts with the department to provide direct services to children
policies.InvestReq_OtherSpecify: Refer to law enforcement, ombudsmen, and county attorney and if applicable, county interdisciplinary child information team for concurrent investigation
policies.ReportInfo_OtherSpecify: Police involvement; Any other information the maker of the report believes might be helpful in establishing the cause of the injuries or showing the willful neglect and the identity of the person or persons responsible for the injury or neglect; The facts that led the person reporting to believe the child has suffered injury or injuries or willful neglect
policies.InvestQual_TrainingSpecify: Initial training to obtain Child Protection Specialist certification; 20 hours of additional training each year
policies.AntiDiscrim_Who_SomeSpecify: Children and youth in foster care
policies.AntiDiscrim_Who_VarySpecify: Children and youth in foster care are covered for gender identity or expression; All children, youth, and families engaged in the child welfare system are covered for the following characteristics : age, race, sexual orientation, disability, religion, national origin, marital status, color, ancestry, sex, political beliefs or affiliations, military or veteran status, genetic information, culture, and social origin or condition
policies.InvestReq_OtherCases_Specify: Child fatalities; Sexual abuse; Exposure of a child to an actual violent offense; Exposure of the child to criminal manufacture or distribution of dangerous drugs
policies.ReporterPenalty_OtherSpecify: Religious healers; Residential worker; An employee of an entity that contracts with the department to provide direct services to children
policies.ScreenerQual_TrainingSpecify: Initial training on intake and screening
policies.AntiDiscrim_Apply_SomeSpecify: When engaging with all children in foster care
policies.AntiDiscrim_Apply_VarySpecify: Gender identity or expression applies when engaging with all children in foster care; The following characteristics apply broadly to all decision points or parts of the child welfare system: age, race, sexual orientation, disability, religion, national origin, marital status, color, ancestry, sex, political beliefs or affiliations, military or veteran status, genetic information, culture, and social origin or condition
policies.AntiDiscrim_Staff_VarySpecify: (1) Age, race, sexual orientation, disability, religion, national origin, marital status, color, ancestry, sex, political beliefs or affiliations, military or veteran status, genetic information, culture, and social origin or condition are specified for staff from child welfare agency, contracted child welfare provider organizations, foster parents, and kinship caregivers; (2) Gender identity or expression is specified for staff from child welfare agency and foster parents and kinship caregivers
policies.ScreenerQual_ExperienceSpecify: 1 year related experience or a combination of related education and experience on a case by case basis
policies.CaseManagerQual_TrainingSpecify: Initial training to obtain Child Protection Specialist certification; 20 hours of additional training each year
